Bleeding after sex
The cells on the surface of 
the cervix often change in 
pregnancy and make it more 
likely	to	bleed	â€“	particularly	
after sex. This is called a 
cervical erosion. Vaginal 
infections can also cause 
a small amount of vaginal 
bleeding.
Ectopic pregnancy
In early pregnancy, bleeding 
may be a sign of an ectopic 
pregnancy or a miscarriage 
(see page 179), although many 
women who bleed at this time 
go on to have normal and 
successful pregnancies.
